alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Calhoun; Clark; Cleveland; Dallas; Jefferson; Lincoln; Monroe; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 9:37AM CDT until May 12 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Monroe County in eastern Arkansas... Central Arkansas County in southeastern Arkansas... Cleveland County in southeastern Arkansas... Southeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Arkansas... Northern Lincoln County in southeastern Arkansas... North Central Calhoun County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Clark County in southwestern Arkansas... Southern Dallas County in southwestern Arkansas... Northern Ouachita County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 1210 PM CDT. * At 937 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fordyce, Rison, Bearden, Grady, Kingsland, Sparkman, Thornton, Chidester, Almyra, St. Charles, Whelen Springs, Kedron, Feenyville, Toledo, Nebo, Mt Elba, Linwood, Whitefield, Woodville and Langford. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Calhoun; Clark; Cleveland; Dallas; Jefferson; Lincoln; Monroe; Ouachita
